Data: Hello and welcome to Cricinfo's coverage of the Twenty20 game between Pakistan and Australia being played in Dubai. The news from the middle is that Pakistan have won the toss and opted to field. Younis Khan will not be playing, and Misbah-ul-Haq will step in as captain. Australia have included Brett Lee -
Shoaib Akhtar to Watson, FOUR runs four straightaway, short of a length outside off, hangs his bat out, edges it well wide of second slip for a boundary wide of third man
Shoaib Akhtar to Watson, 1 run punished, back of a length outside off, bowled at 144.8 kmph, crashed through the covers for a boundary
Shoaib Akhtar to Haddin, no run back of a length outside off and moving away, left alone by Haddin
Shoaib Akhtar to Haddin, no run good pace, around 140.6 kmph, full and wide, swinging away, Haddin made room to smash that over the covers, missed
Shoaib Akhtar to Haddin, no run kept a little low, slightly short and zipped under his bat as he tried to play at it
Shoaib Akhtar to Haddin, 1 run fullish outside off and moving away, drove at it, got a thick edge down to third man for a single
Tanvir to Haddin, no run gets it to move away, short of a good length outside off, pushed at it off the back foot, missed
Tanvir to Haddin, no run on middle and off, gets forward and defends it wide of midwicket, calls for a single but then decides against it
Tanvir to Haddin, FOUR runs good length outside off, gets half-forward and pushes it firmly through the gap between point and cover
Tanvir to Haddin, no run fullish on the off stump, punched straight to cover
Tanvir to Haddin, (no ball) wayward delivery, too wide, but its also a no-ball, so freehit time
Tanvir to Haddin, 1 run length ball but he failed to dispatch it, swung hard but mistimed it to mid-on and salvaged a single
Tanvir to Watson, 2 runs probing him outside off, gets forward, goes hard at it, mistimes it but manages to slice it over cover and point for a couple more
Shoaib Akhtar to Haddin, 1 leg bye angling into the pads, pretty quick, 141.2 kmph, tried to clip it fine, was struck on the pads
Shoaib Akhtar to Watson, 2 runs straying on the pads, flicked away behind square, wide of fine leg for a couple

Shoaib Akhtar to Watson, 4 runs too straight, good length on middle, they end up running four after he whips it away into the big gap between mid-on and midwicket, it's a big ground and they've just about made it on the fourth run
Shoaib Akhtar to Watson, FOUR runs quickest ball of the game dismissed for a boundary, banged in short on middle at 145.6 kmph, gets forward and pulls it away over midwicket
Shoaib Akhtar to Watson, (no ball) down the leg side, wide, no it's worse, he's also overstepped, freehit coming

Shoaib Akhtar to Watson, 1 run Aleem Dar escapes a snorter, low full toss drilled past the bowler but crashes into the stumps at the non-striker's end, Watson will be disappointed, Dar will breathe easy
Shoaib Akhtar to Haddin, no run good length outside off, makes room to bludgeon it through the covers, misses out
Tanvir to Watson, 2 runs straight on leg stump, flicked away wide of Shoaib at fine leg for a quick couple
Tanvir to Watson, FOUR runs slower one punished, bowled at 107.2 kmph, short outside off and he drags it wide of midwicket, Rajasthan Royals team-mates these two but no mercy from the Australian
Tanvir to Watson, FOUR runs smashes him again, banged in short on the off and he smacks that between mid-on and midwicket for four more
Tanvir to Watson, FOUR runs atrocious bowling, three in a row, short on middle this time, pulled away wide of square leg this time, Australia are cruising here
Tanvir to Watson, 1 run back of a length, outside the off stump this time, chopped down to third man
Tanvir to Haddin, no run opens the face and plays it to point, end of a highly productive over
Umar Gul to Watson, OUT looked out but did he get an inside edge? Full on middle and leg, tried to force it through the leg side, is hit on the pads but replays showed he nicked it
Umar Gul to Hopes, no run
Umar Gul to Hopes, no run bouncer outside off, backs away from it
Umar Gul to Hopes, no run good length outside off, driven on the up to cover
Umar Gul to Hopes, 1 run shy at the non-striker's end and just misses, would have been close, pushed away wide of point and sets off, was stretching and a direct hit would have had him
Umar Gul to Haddin, 1 run moving back in, pushed away wide of mid-on for a quick single
Tanvir to Haddin, 1 run slower one bowled on a good length on the off, was late to pick it, adjusted well to push it towards mid-off for a single
Tanvir to Hopes, 1 run short of a good length outside off, guided down to third man for a single
Tanvir to Haddin, 1 run short on the off, dragged wide of midwicket for a single
Tanvir to Hopes, 2 runs fullish on the off, punched between cover and mid-off for a single, a direct hit from Afridi at the non-striker's end, a wasted throw, and they take one more on the ricochet
Tanvir to Hopes, 1 run low full toss on the off, punched wide of Afridi again for a quick single
Tanvir to Haddin, 3 runs nicely placed, half-volley and he squeezes it between cover and cover-point for three more
Ajmal to Haddin, 1 run poor throw, pushed wide of midwicket and sets off, a horrendous throw at the non-striker's end and they complete a single
Ajmal to Hopes, 1 run tossed up outside off, swept wide of square leg for a single
Ajmal to Haddin, no run short of a length outside off, makes room to cut, misses
Ajmal to Haddin, FOUR runs picked the doosra, tossed up on the off, slogged away wide of long-on for a boundary
Ajmal to Haddin, no run
Ajmal to Haddin, 2 runs flighted on middle, comes down the track and flicks it away wide of deep square leg for two more
Afridi to Hopes, OUT wicket first ball, no doubt about this one, went on straight, Hopes went for the slog-sweep, missed, and was struck in line with leg stump on the back leg

Afridi to Symonds, OUT gone first ball and he's on a hatrick! Straighter one again, holding its line, bowled on middle, he's half-forward and just dabs at it playing for the spin, misses and is struck dead in front of middle
Afridi to Hussey, no run on leg stump, rapped on the pads but that was drifting down
Afridi to Hussey, no run
Afridi to Hussey, no run pushed off the front foot to cover
Afridi to Hussey, no run poor ball, should have been dealt with but missed out, went for a mighty pull over midwicket, mistimed it, end of a double-wicket maiden
Malik to Haddin, 2 runs tossed up on middle, driven uppishly wide of the bowler to long-on
Malik to Haddin, 1 run back of a length on the off, punched to long-on off the back foot
Malik to Hussey, no run went on straight, pushed back off the front foot to Malik
Malik to Hussey, 2 runs tossed up, came down and bunted it down to long-on
Malik to Hussey, no run gets out of the crease to push it into the off side, misses and Akmal clips off the bails but he's dragged his foot back in time
Malik to Hussey, 1 leg bye turned away awkwardly into the leg side behind square, brushed his pads
Afridi to Hussey, 2 runs gave it some air, got to the pitch and chipped it wide of long-off for a couple
Afridi to Hussey, no run straighter one on leg stump, hit high on the pads
Afridi to Hussey, OUT chopped it on!! Pakistan are on top, gave it some air, landed short, drifted into the batsman, went for the cut, got an inside edge straight onto the stumps, Afridi has three!
Afridi to Ferguson, no run went through him, spun away just a touch and he pushed at it expecting it to turn more, was bamboozled
Afridi to Ferguson, 1 run turned away into the leg side in front of square for a single
Afridi to Haddin, 1 run short of a length outside off, nudged wide of short-third for a quick single
Malik to Haddin, 1 run short of a length on the off, whipped away to deep midwicket
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run kept a little low, slightly short on the off, turns it away to deep square leg

Malik to Haddin, OUT Five down, slightly quicker through the air, bowled on middle, charged down the track to clear long-off, the bat turned in his hand as he went for it and ended miscuing it straight to Gul at long-on

Malik to Ferguson, 1 run Afridi almost pulled off another one there, the throw from extra-cover is wayward, hurls it well wide of the keeper and Marcus North who responded to a single was a gonner if that was even near accurate
Malik to North, 1 run thrown up on leg side, turned wide of square leg
Malik to Ferguson, 2 runs got an under edge over the keeper wide of short third for a couple
Afridi to North, no run on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
Afridi to North, 1 run the googly, produced the leading edge, kept it down as he tried to close the face
Afridi to Ferguson, 1 run on middle and off, reverse-swept gently wide of short third
Afridi to North, 1 run flighted on middle and leg, pushed through the line wide of midwicket
Afridi to Ferguson, 1 run pushed him back with the short one, whipped away to deep square leg
Afridi to North, 1 run an attempted googly on the off, punched down to long-off
Umar Gul to North, no run back of a length on the off, defended to mid-off
Umar Gul to North, 1 run bouncer on leg stump, fails to get hold of it, gloves it while attempting a hook and gets a single short of square leg
Umar Gul to Bracken, no run back of a length outside off, swung away as he prodded at it to beat the outside edge
Umar Gul to Bracken, 1 run swinging into middle and leg, presents the full face to push it towards mid-off for a quick single
Umar Gul to North, no run attempted yorker, low full toss on leg stump, bowled at 140.5 kmph, turned away to midwicket
Umar Gul to North, 1 run went after it, the bottom hand came off as he lofted it wide of long-on, but only for a single to keep the strike
Afridi to North, no run goes for the sweep and is rapped on the pads but that pitched outside leg
Afridi to North, FOUR runs poor ball, bowled short outside leg stump, helps it on its way to the vacant fine-leg boundary
Afridi to North, 1 run short of a good length on the off, worked away behind square for a single
Afridi to Bracken, no run tossed up outside off, landed on a good length, went for a swat over the bowler's head, missed
Afridi to Bracken, no run appeal for lbw, on leg stump and spinning away, tried to defend it with a straight bat but was beaten by the turn, struck the back pad but maybe a touch too high
Afridi to Bracken, no run
Malik to North, 1 run flighted on the off stump, driven firmly but straight to long-off, just a single
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run gets under a flighted one and chips it towards long-off
Malik to North, 1 run full and wide, sliced away to deep cover

Malik to Ferguson, OUT missed a straight one, expected it to spin in and pushed at it hard, beat the outside edge but Akmal was quick with his hands, taking off the bails with Ferguson's foot still in the air
Malik to Hauritz, no run flighted on middle, pushed down the ground
Malik to Hauritz, 1 leg bye spun in sharply to catch him on the pads but he was outside the line, end of another successful over
Ajmal to Hauritz, 1 run on middle and leg, worked away to deep midwicket

Ajmal to North, no run appeal for a stumping, tossed up outside off, missed the sweep as it spun away, he had stepped out of the crease and replays indicate that only a tiny part of his foot was behind the line when the bails were dislodged. Extremely close, but he wins the benefit of the doubt
Ajmal to North, 2 runs flighted outside off, opens the face to guide that between short third and point
Ajmal to North, 2 runs almost chopped it on, too close to cut, got an under edge just wide of the off stump and over the keeper
Ajmal to North, 1 run round the wicket, fullish on middle, swept away to deep square leg
Ajmal to Hauritz, 1 run on middle and leg, driven wide of Afridi at midwicket for a quick single

Umar Gul to North, OUT timber!! Straight on middle, had some movement on it as well, North was into the shot a little too early as he tried to hoick that over midwicket, missed, and the stumps were pegged back
Umar Gul to Hilfenhaus, no run swinging in again, dug it out back to the bowler, just got his bat down
Umar Gul to Hilfenhaus, no run slower one bowled short of a length outside off, was totally beaten by the pace, it cut away to escape the bat
Umar Gul to Hilfenhaus, no run cut away again, just went through with an ugly drive away from his body, predictably missed it
Umar Gul to Hilfenhaus, no run how did that miss? Got some reverse on that, zipped through the gate to just evade leg stump, Hilfy is flummoxed
Umar Gul to Hilfenhaus, 2 runs good length outside off, makes room and slices it over point for a couple
Ajmal to Bracken, no run flighted outside off, tries to slog it over midwicket, misses the off stump by a whisker
Ajmal to Bracken, 1 run bunts it along the ground to deep square leg
Ajmal to Hilfenhaus, no run almost done in by the doosra, was beaten but got back into his crease in time
Ajmal to Hilfenhaus, no run tossed up outside off, had a massive swipe at it, missed out, failed to read the straighter one
Ajmal to Hilfenhaus, OUT stopped on him a little, tried to turn it away into the leg side, mistimed it to lob it straight to Afridi on the circle at midwicket

Australia have collapsed, squandering an excellent start provided to them by Watson. Ten wickets fell for 66, and like in the early part of the ODI series, the Australian batsmen were virtually clueless against spin, especially Afridi. Gul came back to wrap up the innings, dismissing North, Lee and Hauritz
Brett Lee to bowl. It's been a while for Binga. Salman Butt will face
Lee to Salman Butt, FOUR runs dropped, short and wide, slashes hard, gets a thick edge and North fails to cup it over his head, deflected off the fingers to the boundary, what a start
Lee to Salman Butt, FOUR runs short and wide, punished, crashed through the covers for four, bowled at 144.8 kmph, picked the length early
Lee to Salman Butt, 1 run good length on the off and moving away a hint, plays it hard and gets a thick edge to third man
Lee to Shehzad, no run short of a good length outside off, moving away, left alone to the keeper
Lee to Shehzad, no run quick, bowled at 145.8 kmph, dropped short of the bowler
Lee to Shehzad, no run came back in to beat him through the gate, stood tall to punch that through the off side but was almost done in by the inward movement
Bracken to Salman Butt, 1 run good length outside off, gets back and guides it down to third man
Bracken to Shehzad, no run beaten through the gate came, cut back in sharply and he was made to look awkward, hanging his bat out only to be beaten
Bracken to Shehzad, 1 wide
Bracken to Shehzad, no run slower one bowled full on the off, driven cautiously to mid-off
Bracken to Shehzad, 1 wide too wide, chased it but it kept leaving him, another wide
Bracken to Shehzad, no run charged down the track and went for a big heave over square leg, was not to the pitch, was struck on the ribs as he went after it
Bracken to Shehzad, FOUR runs smashed through the covers, stayed his ground, seized on the width and bludgeoned it through the off side, raced away
Bracken to Shehzad, no run slower one bowled on a good length on the off, dropped into the leg side off the front foot
Lee to Salman Butt, 1 run too early into the shot, tried to drive it through cover, got a thick edge to third man
Lee to Shehzad, no run punched it off the back foot on the rise to cover, bowled at 139.6 kmph
Lee to Shehzad, no run came back in, good length on middle, defended solidly to mid-on, bowled at 146.4 kmph
Lee to Shehzad, no run a hint of desperation there, good length on middle and off, played an ugly swat but mistimed it to mid-off

Lee to Shehzad, OUT banged in short on middle, went for the pull, mistimed it wide of midwicket, hit the high end of the bat and Laughlin dived full length to his left to pluck falling to his left. Shehzad stayed his ground to wait and check if he grassed it while making contact with the ground, but
Lee to Salman Butt, (no ball) 1 run oversteps, good length outside off, pushed at it, got a thick edge behind point to third man, a massive no-ball that and it's time for a freehit
Lee to Kamran, no run slower one bowled on a good length outside off, gets down on one knee to swat that over mid-on, mistimes it completely
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run back of a length on the off stump, came back in, chopped wide of point
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run short on the off, punched off the back foot to cover
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run slower one bowled on a good length on the off, pushed to cover

Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, FOUR runs didn't time it all that well but did a good job to beat the gap between point and cover, short and wide, charged down the track and slapped it with a bit of a reach
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run bouncer banged in on middle, one for the over, was too high, not given a wide
Lee to Kamran, no run
Lee to Kamran, FOUR runs powerfully struck, slightly wide and he square-drove it with disdain through the point region, stood tall while playing it and it came off the middle
Lee to Kamran, no run driven through the line to cover, but didn't time it well enough
Lee to Kamran, no run on middle and off, defended off the back foot in the off side
Lee to Kamran, 1 run fullish on the off stump, eased through the covers for a single
Lee to Misbah, no run short of a good length outside off, played a little away from his body, dabbed it short of cover
Hilfenhaus to Kamran, FOUR runs short and wide and got the treatment, latched onto it quickly, making room and cutting it away between point and cover for four more
Hilfenhaus to Kamran, 1 run good length outside off, swats it down to mid-off where Hauritz fumbles to allow them a single
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, 3 runs straying on the pads, poor line, flicked away behind square, well wide of fine leg for three runs, Misbah is away
Hilfenhaus to Kamran, 1 run back of a length on the off stump, eased away towards third man for a single
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, no run banged in short on middle and off, he ducks under it well
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, no run punched to cover off the back foot, slightly short on the off stump
Lee to Kamran, 1 run good length outside off, makes room, and hits to wide of long-off
Lee to Misbah, no run short of a length, outside off, and punched to cover
Lee to Misbah, 1 run
Lee to Kamran, 1 run slower one, short outside off, is early into the shot and drags it to fine leg
Lee to Misbah, 1 run short and wide, hops, and gets behind the line and opens the face towards third man
Lee to Kamran, 1 run that's driven on the up, fullish outside off, and hit with an open face, but sweeper-cover means it will be only one
Hilfenhaus to Kamran, 1 run short on middle, kept a little low as he went for the pull, got his bat down just in time to get an inside edge onto his pads
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, no run slightly short outside off, bunts it straight to point, struck it well but straight to the fielder
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, no run back of a length on middle, defended to midwicket on the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, no run bouncer, took Misbah by surprise, was a little late into the hook, missed it and went over the bat to Haddin who appealed unconvincingly
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, no run short of a length on middle, defended with a straight bat to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, 1 run getting some good bounce here, got behind it nicely, dropped it short of square leg and set off for a single immediately
Hauritz to Misbah, no run tossed up outside off, took it on the half-volley and tried to drill it past midwicket, got an inside edge onto his pads
Hauritz to Misbah, 2 runs flighted outside off, got outside the line to clip it behind square, wide of deep square leg, for a couple
Hauritz to Misbah, 1 run worked away towards long leg this time, fullish on middle and leg
Hauritz to Kamran, no run tries to improvise, flighted outside off, tried to reverse-sweep it wide of point, was hit on the pads but just outside the line
Hauritz to Kamran, FOUR runs poor ball, short and wide, made room to slash it hard behind point for a boundary to bring up Pakistan's 50
Hauritz to Kamran, no run played for the spin and was beaten by the straighter one, landed on a good length outside off, tried to open the face, missed
Bracken to Misbah, 1 run angling it away from the right hander, tapped wide of Haddin for a quick single
Bracken to Kamran, no run on middle and off, eased to cover off the front foot
Bracken to Kamran, FOUR runs He's been harsh on anything short and wide, and this time's no exception, made room and cut it fiercely over point to beat third man to the boundary
Bracken to Kamran, no run walked down the pitch, fetched it from outside off and slapped it firmly short of mid-on
Bracken to Kamran, 1 run too close to cut, but short again, chopped down to third man
Bracken to Misbah, no run round the wicket to Misbah, dropped short of point
Hauritz to Kamran, 1 run bowled flat outside off, taps it short of point for a quick single
Hauritz to Misbah, 1 run flatter trajectory again, moves across and pushes it wide of midwicket for a single
Hauritz to Kamran, no run spinning in, defended off the front foot in the direction of square leg

Hauritz to Kamran, 2 runs gave him the charge even before the ball was bowled, drilled it down the ground past the bowler, Brett Lee ran yards to his left from long-on and dragged it back just inside the ropes
Hauritz to Kamran, no run short of a length outside off, went for the cut, kept low, missed
Hauritz to Kamran, no run tossed up on middle, reaches forward and bunts it down the ground to long-on
Hopes to Misbah, 1 wide starts off with a wide down the leg side, tries to glance it fine, didn't have to, earns a run
Hopes to Misbah, no run on target this time, slightly short just outside off, pushed to cover
Hopes to Misbah, 1 run dropped, chipped it back to the bowler, a fairly straightforward chance, on a driving length but he wasn
Hopes to Kamran, 1 run comes down and swipes it towards deep midwicket for a couple more
Hopes to Misbah, no run pushed on the rise off the back foot towards cover
Hopes to Misbah, FOUR runs cashed in on a short one, banged in on middle, pulled away comfortably between fine leg and deep square leg for his first boundary
Hopes to Misbah, 1 run on middle and leg, gets forward and works it towards deep square leg for a single
Hauritz to Misbah, 1 run straihgt on middle, clipped wide of short fine for a single
Hauritz to Kamran, no run on middle and leg, turned to short fine, waited for it to spin into him
Hauritz to Kamran, FOUR runs tossed up on the off stump, gets his left foot away and clubs it inside out between deep cover and long-off for a boundary
Hauritz to Kamran, 1 run attempts a similar shot this time but fails to get to the pitch, gets a thick outside edge over point for a single
Hauritz to Misbah, 1 run worked away off the front foot wide of midwicket
Hauritz to Kamran, 1 run comes down the track and chips it towards long-on to keep the strike

Hopes to Kamran, SIX runs banged in short on the off, pulled it away powerfully over long-on, went off the middle and though for a while it seemed he hadn't struck it well enough, it cleared the ropes quite comfortably in the end

Hopes to Kamran, SIX runs even better, if the previous one was brute force, this one was beautifully timed, full on middle and leg, reached forward, bent low and paddled it over fine leg for another big one
Hopes to Kamran, no run back of a length outside off, mistimed a cut to cover
Hopes to Kamran, no run and again, too close to cut this time, hits the inside half of the bat as he tries to force that through the off side
Hopes to Kamran, 1 wide
Hopes to Kamran, 1 run
Hopes to Misbah, 1 run
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, 1 run worked away off the front foot through square leg
Hilfenhaus to Kamran, no run
Hilfenhaus to Kamran, 2 runs fullish on the off stump, gets to the pitch and drives it wide of deep cover for a couple, only a matter of time now

Hilfenhaus to Kamran, 1 run full toss on middle and leg, whipped away to deep midwicket to reach his fifty, excellent innings, saw off the pressure after the loss of the openers with a superb counterattack
Hilfenhaus to Misbah, 1 run banged in short outside leg stump, helped on its way to fine leg
Hilfenhaus to Kamran, no run low full toss on middle and leg, driven straight to midwicket, failed to beat the gap there
Bracken to Misbah, 1 run good length on the off stump, pushed off the back foot towards mid-off for a quick single
Bracken to Kamran, 2 runs length ball outside off, went for a massive heave over mid-on, ended up miscuing it in the direction of deep point where Lauglin dived forward but failed to reach it
Bracken to Kamran, SIX runs short outside off, stood his ground, and slapped it with contempt into the stands over the bowler's head
Bracken to Kamran, 1 run on middle, swiped it to deep square leg, was looking to deposit that into the stands as well but didn't connect well enough
Bracken to Misbah, no run bouncer outside off, chases it from the crease, looks to upper cut it, misses
Bracken to Misbah, 1 run full outside leg stump, clipped to fine leg to level the scores
Hauritz to Malik, no run low full toss, bunts it straight to mid-off
Hauritz to Malik, 1 wide fired in down the leg side, called a wide, sealing a comprehensive win for Pakistan
That's all from here folks. Thanks for tuning in, sending us your feedback, and it's been a pleasure bringing you these six matches. Take care, sleep well. Adios!
A joint Man-of-the-Match award here, for Gul and Afridi.

A one-sided affair in the end, though it didn't look to be going that way when Watson was going strong in the Australian innings. But the spin of Afridi, and the accuracy of Gul saw to it that the Australians were kept down to a paltry score. Butt started well, but when both openers fell in fairly quick su
Pakistan won by 7 wickets (with 22 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Shahid Afridi, PAK
